abstract: British Airways said it had agreed a recovery plan for its $5.5 billion pension deficit, potentially removing a final obstacle to its planned merger with Spain’s Iberia.
snippet: British Airways said it had agreed a recovery plan for its $5.5 billion pension deficit, potentially removing a final obstacle to its planned merger with Spain’s Iberia.
lead_paragraph: British Airways said it had agreed on a recovery plan for its £3.7 billion ($5.5 billion) pension deficit, potentially removing a final obstacle to its planned merger with Spain’s Iberia.

headline.main: B.A. Makes Pension Deal to Keep Merger on Track

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Iberia Lineas Aereas de Espana SA
